recipe.name: Chelo Kabab (aka Kebab)
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees 2. Mix ground beef, grated onion, sumac, turmeric, salt and pepper in a bowl 3. Put 1 spoon (tablespoon?) of avocado oil in 9” x 13” pyrex dish 4. Flatten meat, onion and spice mixture mixture evenly in the bottom of the pyrex dish 5. Score the meat parallel to the 9 inch side, so that it looks like 1-inch wide kebabs 6. Make indentations across the kebabs 7. Bake in the 375 oven for 35 min 8. Slice three large tomatoes 9. Put 1 tsp of avocado oil in pan 10. Fry tomatoes gently 11. Once the tomatoes sizzle, sprinkle some sumac on them 12. Flip the tomatoes after the first side is cooked 13. Sprinkle more sumac on them 14. Grind a small amount of saffron with a mortar and pestle 15. Add 1/8 cup of (boiling) hot water and let it steep like tea 16. Mix the saffron water with 2 tablespoons of butter 17. Cook the basmati rice 18. Plate the rice, the two kebabs and the tomatoes (in that order), leaving some rice exposed 19. The kebabs and the tomatoes make a shape similar to a capital D 20. Drizzle the saffron butter over the rice and kebabs
